articles.title: North-South Red Cross Working Contact Made
articles.content:
North-South Red Cross Working Contact Made
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- An inter-Korean Red Cross working contact was made in Kaesong Friday.
					 At the contact the DPRK side recalled that it actively proposed arranging the reunion of separated families and relatives on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day, guided by noble compatriotism and the spirit of humanitarianism. This was an expression of the DPRK's good will to promote reconciliation and unity and its positive intention to open a new phase of peace and reunification by settling the serious situation prevailing between the north and the south and implementing the north-south joint declarations, it stressed.
					
					 Then the DPRK side advanced a technical proposal regarding the date of arranging the reunion of separated families and relatives, its scope and the exchange of lists of those to be involved, etc. on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day.
					
					 At the contact both sides agreed to hold the reunion of separated families and relatives at Mt. Kumgang resort from Oct. 21 to 27, have the next round of the working contact in Kaesong on Sep. 24 and further the discussion on other technical matters related to the reunion.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy from Syrian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy from Syrian President
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a message of sympathy from Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, on Aug. 23 as regards the recent floods that hit many parts of the DPRK, causing serious damage.
					 The message said:
					
					 We got the shocking news that the DPRK suffered serious damage from the floods that hit its many parts.  
					
					 In this regard, I, on behalf of the Syrian Arab people and myself, express deepest consolation and sympathy to Your Excellency and the friendly Korean people.
					
					 We are sure that you will overcome this disaster. 
					
					 Sincerely yours.

articles.title: 12th Pyongyang International Film Festival Opens
articles.content:
12th Pyongyang International Film Festival Opens
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The 12th Pyongyang International Film Festival opened with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture on Friday.
					 Present there were Kang Nung Su, vice-premier, Hong Kwang Sun, chairman of the festival organizing committee who doubles as chairman of the State Film Commission, Ryang Man Gil, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of film and working people in the city.
					
					 Also present were delegations and delegates of various countries including the DPRK, those of overseas Koreans, guests of honor and members of international jury.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys and embassy officials of various countries and members of missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Showed at the ceremony were videos introducing films presented to the festival.
					
					 Hong Kwang Sun in an opening address hoped that the festival would serve as a meaningful occasion for deepening ties of friendship and swapping achievements and experience gained in making films among moviemen.
					
					 Kong Kantara, under-secretary of State of the Ministry of Culture and Fine Arts of Cambodia, and Kanji Inoki, president of the Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan, attended the ceremony as guests of honor. They in their congratulatory speeches said that the festival has contributed to boosting friendship among moviemen of various countries, hoping that the festival would develop into a worldwide festival of great significance.
					
					 Members of international jury were introduced.
					
					 The organizing committee of the festival hosted a reception for the festival participants at Yanggakdo International Hotel on the same day.

articles.title: National Farm Machine Exhibit and Meeting of Inventors Held
articles.content:
National Farm Machine Exhibit and Meeting of Inventors Held
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- A national farm machine exhibition and meeting of inventors took place in Koksan County, North Hwanghae Province between Sept. 15 and 17.
					 Exhibited at the exhibition were more than 250 pieces of farm machines and farm implements of 26 kinds contrived and manufactured by officials, scientists, technicians and working people in the field of agriculture in the course of conducting scientific researches and mass technical innovation movement.
					
					 The inventors' meeting exchanged the achievements and experience gained in the course of contriving, manufacturing and introducing valuable farm machines conducive to developing the country's agriculture and discussed the scientific and technological issues arising in agricultural production.

articles.title: Poster for Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Released
articles.content:
Poster for Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Released
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- A poster for the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show to celebrate the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea has been produced.
					 Depicted in the poster are Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia in full bloom and the Party Founding Memorial Tower standing against the background of the blue sky.
					
					 Also seen in it are letters reading "Celebration of 65th birthday of WPK" and "Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show" and the emblem of the show as well as the venue and the period of the show.

articles.title: DPRK Advances to Semifinals in U-17 Women's World Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Advances to Semifinals in U-17 Women's World Cup
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK women's football team defeated its German rival 1:0 at the quarterfinals of the 2010 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup, qualifying to advance to semifinals. 
					 The DPRK team beat its Chilean rival 3:0 and its Trinidad and Tobago rival 1:0 in the league match of group A, thus placing second to advance to quarterfinals.
					
					 A long distance ball strongly kicked by Kim Kum Jong at around the 44th minute in the first half was netted to the dismay of the German goal-keeper.

articles.title: Disabled People under Good Care
articles.content:
Disabled People under Good Care
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Various activities have been conducted to take care of the disabled in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The DPRK law on the Protection of the Person with Disability, adopted in June Juche 92 (2003), stipulates that the State shall respect their personality and guarantee their socio-political rights, freedom and interests equal to the healthy persons.
					
					 The Korean Federation for the Protection of the Disabled carries on assistance, protection and information activities in line with the government's popular policies to encourage the disabled to play their role for the collective and society.
					
					 The federation has directed much effort to updating sanatoriums and supplying medical institutions with up-to-date appliances and technologies for recuperation and treatment.
					
					 It has built a prosthetic appliances factory to provide disabled people with necessary instruments including walking staffs and chairs, and consolidated material and technical foundations of their education and amusements.
					
					 It has also provided them with conditions for taking part in social labor.
					
					 Meanwhile, the federation has a wide-ranging exchange and cooperation with international organizations and relevant organizations of other countries.

articles.title: Kumranjigyejon, Poetical Work Eulogizing Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Kumranjigyejon, Poetical Work Eulogizing Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Many literary works praising President Kim Il Sung as lodestar of national liberation and the sun of the nation were created during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					 Among them is Kumranjigyejon the President mentioned in his reminiscences "With the Century" (vol. 6).
					
					 The name of association, "Kumran", means that a united mind is as sharp as an iron edge and as fragrant as an orchid. In other words, it indicates deep feelings between friends, construed as an association of close friends.
					
					 Before the liberation of the country, Pukchong people, strong in anti-Japanese sentiments, formed the Kumran Association.  
					
					 Kumranjigyejon means writings containing the will of the association members.
					
					 The members of the association frequently met in a thick pine grove in Chonghung-ri, Pukchong County, and cultivated themselves morally while pretending to enjoy composition to hoodwink the Japanese police. In this course the oldest member, respected for his wide knowledge, composed Kumranjigyejon.  
					
					 He was the chairman of the Pukchong Branch of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland.
					
					 He had a chance to meet with anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk in summer of Juche 26 (1937) and was informed of the idea of "The Ten-point Programme of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland" worked out by the President and his policy of an all-people resistance. Under her guidance, he expanded and strengthened the branch.
					
					 His poem, Kumranjigyejon, lauds the President as "the one and only leader", "justice of the nation" and "the sun".
					
					 It has been conveyed until now, quoted by books on the revolutionary history of the President and the history of the Workers' Party of Korea and found in Korean Encyclopedia.

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Ready for S. Korea's Attempt at Preemptive Attack
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Ready for S. Korea's Attempt at Preemptive Attack
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group recently disclosed its reckless scenario for invading the DPRK through a preemptive attack, talking about a "switchover in its military policy toward the north" and the like. A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Friday in this regard:
					 At the recent "meeting for overall state security review" the puppet group had a confab on adopting a flexible deterrent strategy calling for preempting an attack on the DPRK in advance when there is a sign of launching nukes and missile or a war from somebody as its "military policy toward the north".
					
					 This is a serious military provocation and extremely dangerous war action against the DPRK as it proclaimed to make a switchover from "defensive strategy", which it advocated for mere form's sake in the past, to offensive strategy.
					
					 The recent confab clearly proved that the puppet warhawks rounded off the operation for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK through war exercises and entered the phase of officially adopting it as its "military strategy toward the north" on the basis of that move. 
					
					 The puppet group is now hell-bent on escalating confrontation and launching a war despite the domestic and foreign public opinion desirous of dialogue and detente.
					
					 The war exercises being staged almost everyday in south Korean and the East and West Sea of Korea show that the puppet group are none other than the warmongers aware of nothing but confrontation and war.
					
					 When looking back on history, aggressors launched wars through surprise preemptive attacks but they couldn't escape a miserable end.
					
					 The group has gone so foolish as to threaten a preemptive attack but it will get nothing but miserable self-destruction.
					
					 The DPRK is prepared to counter any preemptive attack.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday in a signed article praises President Kim Il Sung as a peerlessly distinguished thinker and theoretician and outstanding statesman who made a history of building a new independent power.
					The immortal feats the President performed in the history of power building lie in that he built a new-type revolutionary power strictly based on the independent and popular character, the first of its kind in history, and reinforced the people's power as a powerful weapon for socialist construction which stands firm in any storm and stress and built it into an ideal political organization which remains vital not only in the present era but also in the distant future, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					The President propounded unique ideas and theories on the power building on the principle of independence, not wedded to the established theories and experience, and built a new Juche-type people's power in conformity with the aspiration of the people and the specific conditions of the country.
					
					The people's power built and strengthened by the President represents the popular masses' independent rights, organizes the creative ingenuity and activities, plays the role of a master responsible for the people's living and protects their independent and creative life.
					
					The people's power is an iron-willed political organization which regards it as the fundamental principle of its activities to ensure strong sense of organization and monolithic character. It, at the same time, regards the political method based on the love and trust, unity and cooperation as the basic mode of its activities.
					
					The immortal feats the President performed in the history of building a new independent power will always remain shining along with the prosperous DPRK dynamically dashing ahead toward the eminence of a thriving socialist nation, demonstrating its dignity for its independence and Songun, concludes the article.

articles.title: Those Convicted in Minjok Ilbo Case Confirmed Not Guilty
articles.content:
Those Convicted in Minjok Ilbo Case Confirmed Not Guilty 
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The puppet Seoul High Court on Sept. 14 confirmed the acquittal of Yang Su Jong, who was convicted of his involvement in the Minjok Ilbo case, at a retrial, against the background in which the truth behind anti-DPRK plots hatched by the erstwhile fascist dictatorial regimes is disclosed one after another in south Korea.
					 The Minjok Ilbo case was a conspiratorial case in which the puppet military dictatorial forces forcibly closed the newspaper for having a progressive tendency in 1961 and punished Jo Yong Su, its manager, and others by "a special law on punishing special criminals" on charges of "praising, encouraging and sympathizing with the north". 
					
					 The disclosure of truth behind this case in January of 2008 led to confirming the acquittal of Jo Yong Su who had been unjustly sentenced to death and declaring not guilty Yang Su Jong, who was editor-in-chief of the newspaper.

articles.title: Joint Investigation into Warship Case Called for
articles.content:
Joint Investigation into Warship Case Called for 
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic and public organizations including the Solidarity for Progress, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty separately made public statements on Sept. 14 in demand of the north-south joint investigation into the warship case.
					 The statements noted: The final report on the results of the investigation into the case released by the Ministry of Defense makes it hard for the people to believe the results of the investigation made public by the joint investigation team earlier as it failed neither to make correct clarifications of crucial suspicions nor produce related evidence. 
					
					 Was the military authorities' hasty announcement of the final report without giving any particular clarification not aimed to cover up the truth behind the case? the statements queried. 
					
					 Noting that the final report would touch off deeper distrust among people, the statements demanded the "government" respond to the call of the public at home and abroad for the south-north joint investigation into the case.
					
					 On the same day, the civic and public organizations held a news conference demanding the probe into the truth behind the "Cheonan" case. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea at a news conference on Sept. 13 urged the U.S. and south Korean authorities to stop hostile actions straining the situation of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Vow to Struggle for Peace
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Vow to Struggle for Peace 
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- More than 10 civic and public organizations of south Korea including the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration held the 132nd action for independent reunification and peace on Sept. 14. 
					 Recalling that the U.S. is set to persistently enforce sanctions against the DPRK, they accused the Lee Myung Bak regime of desperately stepping up the moves against the DPRK under the pretence of the warship case.
					
					 They deplored that the people are suffering damages owing to the diplomatic policy failure of the authorities keen on tightening the alliance with the U.S. 
					
					 The authorities issued a final report on the warship case, but they failed to produce trustworthy evidence, they noted, and continued:
					
					 The "government" should come out for the inspection of state administration and south-north joint investigation into the case in order to correctly probe it as most of the respondents to the recent opinion poll expressed distrust and suspicions over the results of the investigation into the case released by the authorities. 
					
					 The organizations vowed to struggle for peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Celebrated at Its Missions
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Celebrated at Its Missions
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Receptions were given and book and photo exhibitions, friendly meetings and films shows held at the DPRK missions in China, Russia, Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, Syria, Mongolia, Iran, Nepal, Malaysia, Indonesia, India, Bangladesh, Myanmar, South Africa, Ethiopia, Mexico, Brazil, Switzerland, Germany, Italy, Poland and Uzbekistan between Sept. 3 and 9 to celebrate the 62nd birthday of the DPRK.
					On display in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on their glorious revolutionary career and immortal exploits and books and photos showing the course of victory and glory covered by the DPRK.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu", "Korea with Long History", "The Tower of the Juche Idea", "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation", "Pyongyang at Night" and other Korean films.
					
					 Present at the events on invitation were personages of different circles and chiefs of Juche idea study organizations and friendship and solidarity organizations in those countries and diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations to them.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Bulletins Issued to Mark Anniversary of DPRK
articles.content:
Bulletins Issued to Mark Anniversary of DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Bulletins were issued in the Czech Republic and Peru on September 7 and 8 to commemorate the 62nd birthday of the DPRK.
					The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association and the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea jointly released a bulletin carrying the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and articles.
					
					 The bulletin in an article titled "The great President Kim Il Sung" said: The Korean people praise President Kim Il Sung as "our leader" and "our father". He will live forever in the minds of not only the Korean people but also the world progressives as the father of all people.
					
					 In an article entitled "Kim Jong Il--distinguished ideo-theoretical activities" the bulletin noted that he formulated the revolutionary idea of the President as the integrated Juche system of idea, theory and method and has steadily developed it.
					
					 The Peruvian People's Women Union carried in its bulletin an article titled "The 62nd birthday of the DPRK".
					
					 The article elaborated on the fact that the DPRK has thoroughly embodied the Juche idea in all spheres of the state activity and bolstered up the defence capabilities with the original Songun policy, thus demonstrating its dignity as a politico-ideological and military power.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On the Juche Idea" was issued as an e-book on Sept. 8 by the Ecuadorian national preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The work, published on March 31, Juche 71 (1982), deals with the immortal historic exploits of the President who founded the Juche idea and the significance of its foundation. It also refers to how the Juche idea was founded and the philosophical principle, the socio-historical principles, the guiding principles and the historic significance of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Celebrated
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Celebrated
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Meetings, seminars, lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Laos, Mongolia, Nepal, Ethiopia and Iran between Sept. 3 and 7 on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the DPRK.
					On display in the exhibition halls were photos on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed in founding and developing the DPRK and photos showing the glorious course covered by the DPRK.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were Korean films "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu", "Pyongyang at Night", "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Reply of Korea".
					
					 Tong Yeu Tho, chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, said at a meeting that under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung the Korean people defeated the U.S. imperialists in the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War and built a socialist system in the northern half of Korea.
					
					 D. Narantuya, chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Literary College of Mongolia, noted at a meeting that the Korean people have made signal achievements in the dynamic drive to open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012. And the speaker expressed belief that the Korean people would surely hit the target of building a thriving nation.
					
					 Nigatu Dagnachew, chairman of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea, stressed at a seminar that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a socialist power by inheriting the cause of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar in Nepal.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- One spring day in Juche 38 (1949) anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk had a talk with women from south Korea at the foot of the picturesque Moran Hill.
					 The women had waged a valiant struggle in south Korea against the U.S. imperialists and other anti-reunification forces, upholding President Kim Il Sung's policy of national reunification.
					
					 Offering them dishes she prepared at home, she said she was very happy to meet them, true comrades working hard to relieve the President of his deep concern over the country's reunification. 
					
					 She also said that the President, who had fought against the Japanese imperialists in thick forests of Mt. Paektu not taking rest and meal properly, worked until late at night every day for the reunification of the country though it was liberated.
					
					 Noting that she felt like fighting together with them for the sacred cause of the country's reunification, she requested them to stand in the van of the struggle to reunify the country as wished by the President.

articles.title: Contacto de expertos de la cruz roja entre el Norte y el Sur
articles.content:
Contacto de expertos de la cruz roja entre el Norte y el Sur
 Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 17 en Kaesong el contacto de expertos de la cruz roja del Norte y el Sur de Corea. 
					 En la ocasion, nuestra parte se refirio a que propuso con iniciativa auspiciar el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados con motivo de Chusok (el 15 de agosto lunar) conforme a la sublime fraternidad y el espiritu de humanitarismo y subrayo que esto deviene una muestra de buena fe de fomentar la conciliacion y la unidad y es expresion de activa voluntad de abrir una nueva coyuntura de la paz y la reunificacion al superar la grave situacion creada entre ambas partes intercoreanas y ejecutar las declaraciones conjuntas Norte-Sur.
					
					 Y propuso el programa relacionado con el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados en ocasion de esa efemeride como la fecha, la dimension, el intercambio de listas, etc.
					
					 Ambas partes decidieron realizar dicho encuentro en el monte Kumgang del 21 al 27 de octubre y hacer el 24 del mes en curso en Kaesong el proximo contacto en el cual coincidieron en seguir debatiendo los problemas de trabajo relativos al encuentro.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de consuelo de Bashar Al-Assad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de consuelo de Bashar Al-Assad
Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del  Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recibio el mensaje de consuelo enviado el 23 de agosto por el Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar Al-Assad, en relacion con las recientes inundaciones que azotaron la mayor parte de Corea causando grandes perdidas.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Hemos recibido la informacion impactante de que la RPDC sufrio grandes perdidas por las inundaciones que arrasaron la mayor parte del pais.
					
					En relacion con este desastre natural, expreso la mas profunda condolencia y compasion a Su Excelencia y al amistoso pueblo coreano en nombre del pueblo arabe sirio y en el mio propio.
					
					Estamos seguros de que Usted superara esta desgracia.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad, le manifiesto el testimonio de mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Actos por el 9 de septiembre en representaciones coreanas
articles.content:
Actos por el 9 de septiembre en representaciones coreanas
Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 62o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, tuvieron lugar del dia 3 al 9 recepciones, exposiciones de libros y fotos, encuentros de amistad y proyecciones filmicas en las representaciones coreanas acreditadas en China, Rusia, Vietnam, Laos, Camboya, Siria, Mongolia, Iran, Nepal, Malasia, Indonesia, India, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Sudafrica, Etiopia, Mexico, Brasil, Suiza, Alemania, Italia, Polonia y Uzbekistan.
					En las ocasiones estaban expuestos las obras del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, las fotografias alusivas a sus gloriosas historias revolucionarias e imborrables hazanas, los libros y fotos que dan a conocer la trayectoria de victorias y glorias de la RPDC.
					
					En los encuentros de cine se llevaron a la pantalla los documentales coreanos, incluyendo "La patria que brilla con el fusil del monte Paektu", "Corea que brilla con larga historia", "El Monumento a la Idea Juche", "Lluvia de chispas de la gran potencia prospera" y "Noche de Pyongyang".
					
					Fueron invitados a los actos las personalidades de diversos estratos, los titulares de las organizaciones de estudio de la idea Juche, las entidades de amistad y solidaridad con el pueblo coreano de los respectivos paises, los representantes diplomaticos y los delegados de las organizaciones internacionales acreditados en los citados paises.
					
					Varias personalidades hicieron uso de la palabra en las actividades.

articles.title: Exposicion nacional de maquinas agricolas y reunion de inventores
articles.content:
Exposicion nacional de maquinas agricolas y reunion de inventores
Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 15 al 17 en el distrito de Koksan de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte la Exposicion Nacional de Maquinas Agricolas y la reunion de sus inventores.
					Fueron exhibidos mas de 250 maquinas y aperos agricolas de 26 generos inventados por los funcionarios, cientificos, tecnicos y trabajadores de la rama agricola mediante la investigacion cientifica y el movimiento masivo por la innovacion tecnica.
					
					En la reunion de inventores los participantes intercambiaron los exitos y experiencias alcanzados en la invencion y la aplicacion de las maquinas agricolas de gran valor que van a contribuir al desarrollo de la agricultura del pais, y discutieron los problemas cientificos y tecnicos que surgen en la produccion agricola.
